name: Heatran
flavorText: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Basic Energy cards attached to Heatran. (If you can't discard cards, this attack does nothing.

name: Lucario
flavorText: By catching the aura emanating from others, it can read their thoughts and movements.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Lucario by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon

name: Luxray
flavorText: When its eyes gleam gold, it can spot hiding prey–even those taking shelter behind a wall.
Ability1Text: As long as Luxray is your Active Pokémon, any damage done by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, Luxray does 40 damage to itself.

name: Probopass
flavorText: It exudes strong magnetism from all cover. It controls three small units called Mini-Noses.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

name: Yanmega
flavorText: By churning its wings, it creates shock waves that inflict critical internal injuries to foes.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard an Energy attached to Yanmega.

name: Cherrim
flavorText: It blooms during times of strong sunlight. It tries to make up for everything it endured as a bud.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage and remove 3 damage counters from Cherrim.

name: Carnivine
flavorText: It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling saliva, then chomps down. It takes a whole day to eat prey.
Attack1Text: Before doing damage, count the remaining HP of the Defending Pokémon and Carnivine. If the Defending Pokémon has fewer remaining HP than Carnivine's, this attack does 60 damage instead.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Luxio
flavorText: Its claws loose electricity with enough amperage to cause fainting. They live in small groups.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Chimchar
flavorText: It agilely scales sheer cliffs to live atop craggy mountains. Its fire is put out when it sleeps.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Chimchar.

name: Croagunk
flavorText: Its cheeks hold poison sacs. It tries to catch foes off guard to jab them with toxic fingers.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play any Supporter cards from his or her hand during his or her next turn.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Happiny
flavorText: It loves round white things. It carries an egg-shaped rock in imitation of CHANSEY.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Chansey from your hand onto Happiny (this counts as evolving Happiny) and remove all damage counters from Happiny.
Attack1Text: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

name: Piplup
flavorText: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Riolu
flavorText: Its body is lithe yet powerful. It can crest three mountains and cross two canyons in one night.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Turtwig
flavorText: Made from soil, the shell on its back hardens when it drinks water. It lives along lakes.
